overview: June D. Manning has served as the editor-in-chief at VerusMed since 2003 after originally joining the company in 2000 as a medical writer. She oversees the development and delivery of all VerusMed clinical news briefs. Manning leads a team of 10 medical editors and writers, and is responsible for achieving the company’s goals for timeliness, objectivity and relevance. She works closely with VerusMed’s editorial advisory board of leading physicians and serves as the company’s primary editorial spokesperson. Manning is responsible for developing new content services and creating information business strategies to engage new physician users. Prior to joining VerusMed, Manning was a news reporter for Aberdeen News in South Dakota and the Arizona Republic in Phoenix. She received her BA in journalism from Arizona State University and is a member of the American Medical Writers Association and the Association of Health Care Journalists.
